properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 6:38PM MST until January 30 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
At 638 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Crystal Lake Campground to 6 miles northwest of
Nunn, moving south at 25 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 336 and
348.

Locations impacted include...
Crystal Lake Reservoir, Granite Springs Reservoir, Crystal Lake
Campground, Granite Springs Campground and Buford.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits.
Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions,
making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped
vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow
squall arrives.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MST FOR SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY AND SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES
